name: Spicy Meatloaf
column7: (pork sausage,3/4 lbs hot)::Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until very crisp and fat has rendered, 8-10 minutes.

name: Oysters Rockefeller::James Beard::(shallots,1/4 cup chopped)
column7: (Pernod,1/3 cup)::Saute the shallots, celery, herbs, and seasonings in 3 tablespoons of the butter for 3 minutes. Add the watercress and let it wilt.

name: Carrot Soup::Alice Waters::(butter,4 Tbsp)
column5: (chicken broth,6 cups)::In a heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter. When it starts to foam, add the onions and thyme and cook over medium-low heat until tender, about 10 minutes.

name: Roast Pork Loin::Alice Waters::(pork loin,1 bone-in, 4-rib)
column4: The day before, separate the meat from the ribs, stopping about 1 inch before the end of the bones. Season the pork liberally inside and out with salt and pepper and refrigerate overnight.
